main event: An Air Force pilot and observer spotted a large, red-orange, cross-shaped object near Monroe, Louisiana in 1956.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a C-47 aircraft and made an abrupt turn to the left, changing to a reddish-white color as it flew away.
The pilot had seen many types of unknown objects in Korea, but this was a new phenomenon he had never seen before.
The object displayed high-speed maneuverability, including hovering, rapid acceleration, and abrupt changes in direction without any visible means of propulsion.
Multiple Air Force and civilian aviation locations were checked, but no reports of aircraft or unusual activity were found to correlate with the sighting.
Weather data, including cloud cover, temperature, and wind conditions, was gathered but did not provide any clear explanation for the sighting.
witnesses: an Air Force pilot and observer
photographs: yes, the report includes a hand-drawn sketch of the object's movement
